edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap
Interface DMAPPropertyFunctionHandler

public interface DMAPPropertyFunctionHandler

This interface allows external objects to handle DMAP slot property functions. DMAP does not implement any standard property functions.

As a filler for a reference slot is considered, the functions attached to that slot are evaluated to see if the filler is 'approved' by that function.

When a slot is filled, all the functions evaluated to check that slot filler are 'recorded' in the property handler so that it can reevaluate them all as fillers for other slots are considered. So, if functions represent constraints between slots, these constraints will continue to be evaluated as each slot is filled.

Author:
R. James Firby

Method Detail

clone

DMAPPropertyFunctionHandler clone()
Create a copy of this handler (including all saved functions). Cloning is needed because each time a slot is filled, it spins off alternate ways that the rest of the pattern might proceed. Each of these alternatives needs a copy of the recorded functional state sot far.

If a function handler does not record any internal state, it may return the same object without copying it.

handles

boolean handles(java.lang.String func)
Check whether this handler knows what to do with this function. If many function handlers are available, DMAP uses only the first one that says it handles the given function.

Parameters:
func - The name of the function of interest.
Returns:
'True' if this handler wants to handle this function.

evalFunction

boolean evalFunction(java.lang.String func,
                     java.lang.String arg,
                     Reference reference)
                     throws DMAPPropertyFunctionException
Evaluate a function to see if it says the reference is an acceptable slot filler. Internally, the handler may check past recorded functions as well.

Parameters:
func - The function to evaluate.
arg - The name of the argument to this function.
reference - The potential slot filler to check.
Returns:
'True' if this function accepts this reference as a slot filler.
Throws:
DMAPPropertyFunctionException - When there is a problem evaluating the function.

recordFunction

void recordFunction(java.lang.String func,
                    java.lang.String arg,
                    Reference reference)
Record the function associated with a slot filler so that it can be reevaluated later to make sure it still holds.

Parameters:
func - The function that was evaluated and should be recorded.
arg - The name of the argument to this function.
reference - The slot filler accepted by this function.
